page.title: 18GREAT MEOLS:THE ELMS COTTAGE
page.content: Mrs. Whylie's home was built in{1691 by the{Washington Family,}who resided there for 5 generations. Constructed of sandstone,the house boasted an unusual roof-a boat!-owned by the builder.This was removed a few years ago because of Death Watch Beetle. The house consists of 2 storeys,a ground floor comprising hall,lounge, kitchen,utility room & drawing room and upstairs of 4 bedrooms and bath. There are several unusual features to the house;one of the windows is of stained glass, as is the porch letter box. On land adjacent to the cottage is a barn constructed of stone and locally quarried sandstone.This barn was one of the first to be built on this land and features a weather-vane; rare in these parts.{The Elms}is one of the few remaining examples of{Old Meols. }
